data.message: Goodbye Facebook Apps, your intrusion has gone far enough and now your forcing people to install your incredibly intrusive messenger app its time I wipe all your apps from my phone. Keep it up and I will deactivate my account as well!

replies.message: We hear your frustration Sean and understand your concerns. You can learn more about app permissions at http://on.fb.me/1nQj9gm. - Elissa

A permission is a permission. Just because I give the key to my house to a neighbor so they can water my plants ( a feature I want) doesn't mean they can't use that same persmission to rifle through the rest of my belongings with that exact "permission" (a total invasion of my privacy). I could never call the police on my neighbor if I found out what they were doing because I gave them persmission to enter my home. Your regular app had too many permissions "required" and your messenger app asked for more and now I have removed your regular app from my phone.

You already admitted to manipulating people's news feeds as a social experiment so your trustworthyness is a ZERO in my book and I am seeing on my wife's feed, Walmart posts and at the top is says "Sean Coughlin Liked Walmart". I never "liked" Walmart. This raises a huge red flag and I am close to pulling facebook off my entire family's devices.

Apparently liking a post means I like the store. Because I see Walmart and Liberty Mutual listed in my likes and I while I have purchased a couple of things from Walmart over the years, have nothing to do with Liberty Mutual which means they must have posted a picture or a meme that I liked and now I forevermore like Liberty Mutual and this information is sent to all my friends.
